text_en: BANGGAI, MERCUSUAR – The Tompotika Resmob Team of the Banggai Police Criminal Investigation Unit (Satreskrim) succeeded in arresting two men SA alias Andi (31) and RM (33), who are suspected of being specialist house break-in thefts, at the Tanjungsari Complex, Kraton Village, Luwuk District, Wednesday (17 /1/2024). Banggai Police Criminal Investigation Unit Head, AKP Tio Tondi in his office, Thursday (18/1/2024) said that the two suspects were suspected of committing theft and entering the house of victim Zaka Hidayah (31), on Thursday (11/1/2024) at around 04.00 WITA. “Because the front door of the house was not locked, the perpetrator managed to enter. "At that time the victim was fast asleep, so they freely took things from the house and managed to escape," said Kasat. According to him, the victim only realized that his house had been burgled when he woke up, and was shocked to see that his belongings were messy and a number of other items were missing. "When the victim checked the items in his room, two gold rings, a rice cooker and a backpack had been lost by the thieves, and the total loss was estimated at IDR 5 million," explained Tio. The victim immediately reported the incident to the Banggai Police. Based on the report, the police immediately carried out an investigation at the crime scene (TKP). After investigation, the two perpetrators were finally arrested. "Now the two perpetrators have been detained at the Banggai Police Headquarters, to undergo further examination and legal proceedings," said Tio. */PAR Head of the Banggai Police Criminal Investigation Unit, AKP Tio Tondi in his office, Thursday (18/1/2024) said that the two suspects were suspected of committing theft and entering the house of victim Zaka Hidayah (31), on Thursday (11/1/2024) around 04.00 WITA. “Because the front door of the house was not locked, the perpetrator managed to enter. title: Bersama Kasat Intel Polres Banggai, Wartawan Gelar Aksi Jumat Berbagi
text: BANGGAI RAYA- Berkolaborasi dengan Kasat Intel Polres Banggai, wartawan di Kota Luwuk melakukan aksi jumat berbagi dengan membagikan makanan berupa nasi kotak di lokasi Cafe Bakul Kopi, Eks Lapangan Tembak, KM 5, Luwuk Selatan, Jumat 19 Januari 2024.Salah satu jurnalis, Emy menerangkan, pembagian makanan berupa nasi kotak adalah salah satu bentuk aksi positif yang digelar oleh Wartawan Banggai bersama Kasat Intel Polres Banggai.Pada Jumat berkah ini, nasi kotak disalurkan kepada para pengendara yang melintas, khususnya ojek dan sopir-sopir angkot.Antusiasme dari para penerima tampak begitu tinggi, mencerminkan kegembiraan mereka dalam menerima bantuan tersebut.Tak hanya sebagai wadah aksi berbagi, kegiatan ini juga diwarnai dengan kehadiran utama PWI Banggai, termasuk Ketua Iskandar Djiada, Imam Muslik, Yuni, Kiki, Amrilah, Asnawi, Sofyan Tah, Sofyan Labolo Alisan serta pengurus dan anggota PWI Banggai lainnya.Kebersamaan mereka dalam momen berbagi Jumat Berkah menunjukkan solidaritas dan semangat berbuat baik di kalangan wartawan.Iskandar Djiada, selaku Ketua PWI Banggai dan pimpinan umum Harian Banggai Raya, menyampaikan rasa syukurnya.“Di Jumat yang penuh berkah ini, Alhamdulillah kami dan rekan-rekan wartawan dari PWI Banggai bisa berbagi,” ucapnya.Ungkapan tersebut mencerminkan kebahagiaan dan kepuasan hati rekan-rekan wartawan dalam berkontribusi positif kepada masyarakat.Kasat Intel AKP Usman mengatakan, aksi berbagi ini tidak hanya menjadi bentuk kepedulian terhadap sesama, tetapi juga memperkuat ikatan solidaritas di antara wartawan dan instansi keamanan.“Semoga kegiatan ini menjadi inspirasi bagi upaya-upaya kemanusiaan di berbagai lapisan masyarakat,” tandasnya. (*)
text_en: BANGGAI RAYA- Collaborating with the Banggai Police Head of Intelligence, journalists in Luwuk City carried out a Friday sharing action by distributing food in the form of rice boxes at the Bakul Kopi Cafe location, Ex Shooting Range, KM 5, South Luwuk, Friday 19 January 2024. One of the journalists, Emy explained that the distribution of food in the form of rice boxes was a form of positive action held by Banggai Journalists together with the Head of Intelligence at Banggai Police. On this blessed Friday, rice boxes were distributed to passing motorists, especially motorbike taxis and public transportation drivers. The enthusiasm of the recipients looked very tall, reflecting their joy in receiving this assistance. Not only as a forum for sharing, this activity was also marked by the main presence of PWI Banggai, including Chairman Iskandar Djiada, Imam Muslik, Yuni, Kiki, Amrilah, Asnawi, Sofyan Tah, Sofyan Labolo Alisan as well as other administrators and members of PWI Banggai. Their togetherness in the moment of sharing Friday Blessings shows solidarity and the spirit of doing good among journalists. Iskandar Djiada, as Chairman of PWI Banggai and general leader of Banggai Raya Daily, expressed his gratitude. "Thank God, we and fellow journalists from PWI Banggai can share," he said. This expression reflects the happiness and satisfaction of fellow journalists in contributing positively to society. Head of Intel AKP Usman said, this sharing action is not only a form of concern for each other, but also strengthen the bonds of solidarity between journalists and security agencies. "Hopefully this activity will be an inspiration for humanitarian efforts at various levels of society," he said. (*)

title: Kapusdal OMB Polres Lakukan Pengecekan di Bawaslu dan KPU Banggai
text: BANGGAI RAYA-Kabag Ren Polres Banggai selaku Kapusdal Operasi Mantap Brata Tinombala Kompol Maikun, SH, MH melakukan pengecekan piket di Kantor Bawaslu dan KPU Banggai, Jumat (19/1/2024).Pengecekan piket ini bagian dari upaya pengawasan dan pengendalian terhadap personel yang bertugas dalam pengamanan di Kantor penyelenggara Pemilu tersebut, dalam rangka memastikan kesiapan menghadapi Pemilihan Umum.Dalam giat tersebut, Ia memeriksa kehadiran seluruh personel pengamanan yang bertugas di lokasi. Dan juga memperhatikan kesiapannya dalam menjalankan tugas pengamanan yang krusial ini.Selain itu, buku mutasi piket juga diperiksa guna memastikan rotasi dan penugasan petugas keamanan berjalan dengan baik.Kompol Maikun mengungkapkan pentingnya upaya pengawasan dan pengendalian ini untuk memastikan kelancaran proses Pemilihan Umum di wilayah hukum Polres Banggai.Dengan pengecekan ini, diharapkan semua personel pengamanan bekerja dengan baik, tertib, dan memastikan keamanan di Kantor KPU dan Bawaslu dalam rangka mendukung pelaksanaan Pemilu yang adil dan demokratis.Pimpinan berharap, piket KPU dan Bawaslu dalam menjalankan tugasnya berjalan dengan baik serta memastikan bahwa segala aspek pengamanan terkait Pemilu di Kabupaten Banggai akan berjalan dengan lancar. (*)
text_en: BANGGAI RAYA-Head of the Banggai Police Rent Department as the Head of the Brata Tinombala Steady Operations Regional Headquarters Kompol Maikun, SH, MH checked the pickets at the Bawaslu and KPU Banggai Offices, Friday (19/1/2024). Checking the pickets was part of efforts to supervise and control the personnel involved served as security at the Election Organizing Office, in order to ensure readiness for the General Election. During this activity, he checked the presence of all security personnel on duty at the location. And also pay attention to their readiness in carrying out this crucial security task. Apart from that, the picket transfer book is also checked to ensure that the rotation and assignment of security officers goes well. Kompol Maikun expressed the importance of this monitoring and control effort to ensure the smooth running of the General Election process in the jurisdiction of the Police. Banggai.With this check, it is hoped that all security personnel will work well, in an orderly manner, and ensure security at the KPU and Bawaslu offices in order to support the implementation of fair and democratic elections. The leadership hopes that the KPU and Bawaslu pickets will carry out their duties well and ensure that All security aspects related to elections in Banggai Regency will run smoothly. (*)

title: Jumat Berkah, PWI Banggai Berbagi Nasi Kotak
text: BANGGAI RAYA- Persatuan Wartawan Indonesia (PWI) Kabupaten Banggai melakukan aksi jumat berkat di jalan depan sekretariat tersebut, Jumat 19 Januari 2024.Jumat berkah ini, PWI Banggai yang dipimpin Iskandar Djiada membagikan nasi kotak untuk para pengendara yang melintas.Sasaran para penerima Jumat berkah, mulai dari ojek dan sopir-sopir angkot. Tampak pengendara yang melintas begitu antusias menerima Jumat berkah.Tampak hadir dalam kegiatan berbagi dalam Jumat Berkah, Ketua PWI Banggai, Iskandar Djiada, Sekretaris Imam Muslik, dan pengurus serta anggota PWI Banggai lainnya.Melalui Jumat berkah ini, Iskandar Djiada berharap bisa bermanfaat bagi masyarakat.“Di Jumat yang penuh berkah ini, Alhamdulillah kami rekan-rekan wartawan dari PWI Banggai bisa berbagi,” ucap Iskandar Djiada yang juga pimpinan umum Harian Banggai Raya itu. (*)
text_en: BANGGAI RAYA- The Association of Indonesian Journalists (PWI) Banggai Regency held a Friday blessing action on the road in front of the secretariat, Friday 19 January 2024. This Friday blessing, PWI Banggai led by Iskandar Djiada distributed boxes of rice to passing motorists. Target recipients of Friday blessing , starting from motorbike taxis and public transportation drivers. The motorists passing by were very enthusiastic about receiving Friday blessings. The Chairman of PWI Banggai, Iskandar Djiada, Secretary Imam Muslik, and other administrators and members of PWI Banggai were present at the sharing activities on Friday Blessings. Through this Friday blessing, Iskandar Djiada hopes to be of benefit to the community. "On this blessed Friday, thank God, our fellow journalists from PWI Banggai can share," said Iskandar Djiada, who is also the general leader of the Banggai Raya Daily. (*)

title: Pemda Banggai dan Kemenkumham Sulteng Tingkatkan Layanan Hukum dengan Agen Layanan Kekayaan Intelektual
text: “Kantor Wilayah Kemenkumham Sulteng dan Pemerintah Daerah Kabupaten Banggai Tandatangani MOU Untuk meningkatkan kualitas Layanan Publik di bidang Hukum dan HAM”KABAR LUWUK –Pemda BanggaidanKemenkumham SultengTingkatkanLayanan Hukumdengan Agen LayananKekayaan Intelektual.Hari Jumat menjadi momentum bersejarah ketika Kantor Wilayah Kementerian Hukum dan Hak Asasi Manusia (Kemenkumham)Sulawesi Tengahdan Pemerintah DaerahKabupaten Banggairesmi menandatanganiMemorandum of Understanding (MoU)untuk meningkatkan kualitas layanan publik dibidang Hukum dan Hak Asasi Manusia (HAM).Penandatanganan yang diselenggarakan di Hotel Swiss Bell Ballroom ini dihadiri langsung oleh Inspektur Jenderal Kementerian Hukum dan Hak Asasi Manusia Republik Indonesia, Ir. Razilu., M.Si., CGCAE pada Jumat (19/1/2024). Irjen Kemenkumham RI menyampaikan terima kasih khusus kepada Bupati Banggai atas dukungan dan kontribusi yang berkelanjutan.Bupati Banggai, Ir. H. Amirudin, MM, AIFO, juga memberikan apresiasi terhadap terobosan dari Kantor Wilayah Kemenkumham Sulawesi Tengah.Salah satu terobosan yang diapresiasi adalah pembukaan Agen Layanan Kekayaan Intelektual (KI) di Kabupaten Banggai.Agen Layanan KI ini menjadi mitra strategis Kemenkumham bersama Pemerintah Daerah Kab. Banggai melalui Badan Riset dan Inovasi Daerah (BRIDA) Kabupaten Banggai untuk memberikan informasi dan edukasi kepada masyarakat tentang Kekayaan Intelektual (KI).“Pada tahun anggaran 2024 ini, telah dialokasikan anggaran di dalam APBD. Kepengurusan hak kekayaan intelektual yang diajukan oleh masyarakat akan bersifat gratis karena PNPB-nya dibayarkan oleh pemerintah daerah Kabupaten Banggai,” ujar Bupati Amirudin.Irjen Kemenkumham RI mengapresiasi inisiatif Kabupaten Banggai yang mengalokasikan Anggaran Pendapatan dan Belanja Daerah (APBD) untuk pendaftaran kekayaan intelektual.Ia menekankan bahwa ini dapat menjadi contoh bagi provinsi, kabupaten, dan kota lainnya untuk mengikuti jejak Banggai dalam hal pendaftaran kekayaan intelektual.Kepala Kantor Wilayah (Kakanwil) Kemenkumham Sulawesi Tengah, Hermansyah Siregar, S.H., M.H, menyatakan bahwa Agen Layanan KI akan memainkan peran vital dalam meningkatkan kesadaran masyarakat tentang pentingnya melindungi hak kekayaan intelektual.“Agen Layanan KI akan memberikan informasi dan edukasi tentang berbagai aspek KI, mulai dari hak cipta, paten, merek, hingga desain industri,” jelas Kakanwil Sulteng.Dengan MoU dan Perjanjian Kerjasama ini, diharapkan sinergi antara Kemenkumham dan Pemerintah Daerah Kabupaten Banggai semakin memperkuat upaya bersama dalam meningkatkan pelayanan Hukum dan HAM serta meningkatkan kesadaran masyarakat terhadap pentingnya melindungi kekayaan intelektual.( dkisp) **
text_en: "The Regional Office of the Ministry of Law and Human Rights of Central Sulawesi and the Regional Government of Banggai Regency Sign an MOU to improve the quality of Public Services in the field of Law and Human Rights" KABAR LUWUK - Banggai Regional Government and the Ministry of Law and Human Rights of Central Sulawesi Improve Legal Services with Intellectual Property Service Agents. )Central Sulawesi and the Regional Government of Banggaire Regency officially signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to improve the quality of public services in the field of Law and Human Rights (HAM). The signing which was held at the Swiss Bell Ballroom Hotel was attended directly by the Inspector General of the Ministry of Law and Human Rights of the Republic of Indonesia, Ir. Razilu., M.Si., CGCAE on Friday (19/1/2024). The Inspector General of the Indonesian Ministry of Law and Human Rights expressed special thanks to the Regent of Banggai for his continued support and contribution. The Regent of Banggai, Ir. H. Amirudin, MM, AIFO, also expressed his appreciation for the breakthrough from the Central Sulawesi Ministry of Law and Human Rights Regional Office. One of the breakthroughs that was appreciated was the opening of an Intellectual Property (KI) Service Agent in Banggai Regency. This KI Service Agent is a strategic partner of the Ministry of Law and Human Rights together with the Regency Regional Government . Banggai through the Regional Research and Innovation Agency (BRIDA) of Banggai Regency to provide information and education to the public about Intellectual Property (KI). "In the 2024 fiscal year, a budget has been allocated in the APBD. "Administering intellectual property rights submitted by the public will be free because the PNPB is paid by the regional government of Banggai Regency," said Regent Amirudin. The Inspector General of the Indonesian Ministry of Law and Human Rights appreciates Banggai Regency's initiative to allocate the Regional Revenue and Expenditure Budget (APBD) for intellectual property registration. He emphasized that this could be an example for other provinces, districts and cities to follow in Banggai's footsteps in terms of intellectual property registration. Head of the Central Sulawesi Ministry of Law and Human Rights Regional Office (Kakanwil), Hermansyah Siregar, S.H., M.H, stated that the KI Service Agent would play a vital role in increasing public awareness about the importance of protecting intellectual property rights. "The IP Service Agent will provide information and education about various aspects of IP, from copyright, patents, brands, to industrial designs," explained the Head of the Central Sulawesi Regional Office. With this MoU and Cooperation Agreement, It is hoped that the synergy between the Ministry of Law and Human Rights and the Regional Government of Banggai Regency will further strengthen joint efforts in improving legal and human rights services as well as increasing public awareness of the importance of protecting intellectual property. (dkisp) **

title: Sebulan 600 Unit Kendaraan Baru, Tak Berbanding dengan Penambahan Jalan di Banggai
text: BANGGAI RAYA-Jumlah penambahan panjang maupun lebar jalan di Kabupaten Banggai tak sebanding dengan volume peningkatan jumlah kendaraan baru.Berdasarkan catatan Satuan Lalulintas Polres Banggai sebagaimana disampaikan Kasat Lantas AKP I Made Bagus Aditya di hadapan wartawan di Luwuk, Jumat (26/1/2024), jumlah kendaraan di Kabupaten Banggai terus mengalami peningkatan pesat. “Untuk kendaraan roda empat sekira 100 unit sebulan, sementara kendaraan roda dua sekira 500 unit sebulan. Itu kendaraan baru yang keluar dari dealer di Luwuk Banggai, sementara penambahan kendaraan baru tapi dari dealer luar daerah dan beroperasi di Banggai, kami tidak tahu jumlahnya,” ujarnya.BACA JUGA:Pengamanan Pemilu, Polres Banggai Kerahkan 421 Personil dan 61 BKO PoldaDengan peningkatan sekira 600 unit kendaraan baru tersebut, belum sebanding dengan peningkatan volume jalan. Karenanya, jalanan di Luwuk kerap macet dan padat kendaraan.BACA JUGA:Usai Upacara, Kanim Banggai Gelar Syukuran Suksesnya Rangkaian Hari Bhakti Imigrasi ke 74Ia berharap juga, warga tak memarkir kendaraan mereka di badan atau bahu jalan, sebab bisa mengganggu arus lalulintas. “Begitu juga warga yang mau beli kendaraan roda empat, harusnya sudah siap dengan garasi, agar tidak menjadikan jalan sebagai tempat parkir,” tegasnya.BACA JUGA:Cuaca Buruk, Nelayan 62 Tahun di Bualemo Hilang MelautTerkait kondisi jalan yang tidak sebanding dengan peningkatan jumlah kendaraan, ia berharap ada langkah bersama dari pemerintah dan kepolisian serta instansi terkait lain, untuk membicarakan masalah ini, sehingga muncul solusi bersama. DAR
text_en: BANGGAI RAYA-The amount of increase in the length and width of roads in Banggai Regency is not commensurate with the volume of increase in the number of new vehicles. Based on the records of the Banggai Police Traffic Unit as conveyed by Head of Traffic Unit AKP I Made Bagus Aditya before journalists in Luwuk, Friday (26/1/2024) , the number of vehicles in Banggai Regency continues to increase rapidly. "For four-wheeled vehicles it is around 100 units a month, while for two-wheeled vehicles it is around 500 units a month. "That's a new vehicle that came out of a dealer in Luwuk Banggai, while the addition of new vehicles is from a dealer outside the area and operates in Banggai, we don't know the number," he said. The 600 new vehicles are not commensurate with the increase in road volume. Because of this, the roads in Luwuk are often congested and congested with vehicles. READ ALSO: After the Ceremony, Kanim Banggai Holds a Celebration of the Success of the 74th Immigration Service Day Series. He also hopes that residents will not park their vehicles on the side of the road or on the shoulder of the road, because it could disrupt traffic flow. "Likewise, residents who want to buy four-wheeled vehicles should have a garage ready, so as not to use the road as a parking lot," he stressed. ALSO READ: Bad Weather, 62-Year-Old Fisherman in Bualemo Lost at Sea Regarding road conditions that are not commensurate with the increase in the number of vehicles , he hopes that there will be joint steps from the government, police and other related agencies, to discuss this problem, so that a joint solution emerges. DAR

title: Disdikbud Banggai Ciptakan Inovasi Belajar Beda Dam Terbaik, Tumbuhkan Minat Anak Didik Pada Komputer Dan Matematika
text: Terasbanggai.com- Dinas Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan (Disdikbud) kabupaten Banggai kembali menciptakan inovasi. Inovasi Belajar Beda dan Terbaik namanya yang disandangkan.Inovasi Disdikbud tersebut melibatkan Guru Penggerak yang ada di daerah ini. “Kegiatan sore ini merupakan kegiatan yang kedua kalinya,” ungkap Kasubag Perencanaan Disdikbud kabupaten Banggai Asly di sela sela kegiatan Inovasi Belajar di taman Aspirasi, Sabtu (27/1/2024). Asly katakan, Inovasi Belajar Beda dan Terbaik yang dilakukan Disdikbud ini bertujuan mengasah pikiran anak anak didik, khususnya di tingkat sekolah dasar meminati pelajaran komputer, matematika. “Kita mendorong agar anak didik sejak di sekolah dasar punya ketertarikan dengan komputer dan matematika. Bersama komunitas guru penggerak inovasi ini sengaja dikemas dalam bentuk outdoor (luar ruangan agar anak didik lebih santai menerima pelajaran,” tuturnya. Terlihat sejumlah orang tua turut mendampingi anak didik yang berasal dari SD Kilongan Permai, kelas 3 dan 4. Inovasi Belajar Beda dan Terbaik ini masih difokuskan pada sekolah dalam wilayah kecamatan Luwuk, Luwuk Utara dan Selatan. “Kedepan kita akan kembangkan di wilayah kecamatan lainnya dan inovasi ini sudah tercatata yang rencananya akan ikut Inovasi Goverment Award (IGA),” tuturnya. Terpisah, Koordinator Guru Penggerak Kabupaten Banggai, Maryam Junaidi mengungkapkan, saat ini terdapat 70 Guru Penggerak di Kabupaten Banggai yang telah lolos seleksi dan mendapatkan sertfikasi guru penggerak. Program Guru Penggerak dari Kemendikbudristek mengajarkan kepada guru tentang metode pembelajaran yang berpusat pada murid. “Kegiatan sore ini merupakan kegiatan yang kedua kalinya,” ungkap Kasubag Perencanaan Disdikbud kabupaten Banggai Asly di sela sela kegiatan Inovasi Belajar di taman Aspirasi, Sabtu (27/1/2024). text_en: Terasbanggai.com- The Department of Education and Culture (Disdikbud) of Banggai district is creating innovation again. Different and Best Learning Innovation is the name given to it. This Disdikbud innovation involves motivating teachers in this area. "This afternoon's activity is the second activity," said the Head of Planning Subdivision, Banggai Regency Education and Culture Office, Asly, on the sidelines of the Learning Innovation activity at the Aspiration Park, Saturday (27/1/2024). Asly said, the Different and Best Learning Innovation carried out by the Education and Culture Department is aimed at sharpening the minds of students, especially those at elementary school level who are interested in computer and mathematics subjects. "We encourage students from elementary school to have an interest in computers and mathematics. "Together with the teacher community, this innovation was deliberately packaged in an outdoor form so that students would be more relaxed in receiving lessons," he said. A number of parents were seen accompanying students from Kilongan Permai Elementary School, grades 3 and 4. Different and Best Learning Innovations "This is still focused on schools in the Luwuk, North Luwuk and South sub-districts. title: Moh Hadiwiyono, Alumni Magang Jepang Nyaleg DPRD Banggai
text: BANGGAI RAYA- Moh Hadiwiyono maju sebagai Caleg DPRD Kabupaten Banggai dari partai Perindo  nomor urut 1 Dapil Banggai IV meliputi Kecamatan Kintom, Batui, Batui Selatan, Moilong, Toili, dan Toili Barat.Lahir di Desa Pasir Lamba kecamatan  Toili, Kabupaten Banggai, serta pengalaman magang di Jepang tahun 1997 sampai 2007 membuat dirinya terpanggil untuk maju pada pileg 2024.Adapun yang membuat keinginannya maju yaitu ingin mewujudkan generasi muda Banggai yang mandiri, kreatif, displin, berkompeten dan memiliki daya saing untuk menjadi pelaku usaha dan bisnis  untuk menambah lapangan pekerjaan di Kabupaten Banggai.BACA JUGA:Gisel, Dosen FISIP Unismuh Luwuk Lolos dan Dibiayai Ikuti Festival Pemuda Dunia di RusiaMengoptimalkan peluang program magang dan kerja ke Jepang dan akan memfasilitasi para calon peserta sampai selesai hingga pulang menjadi pengusaha dibidang masing-masing, dan juga akan membangkitkan serta mengangkat ekonomi kerakyatan (UMKM)Kemudian mengkat wisata,seni, budaya dan olahraga, selain itu akan memajukan ekonomi desa melalui sektor pertanian dan perikanan yang semuanya tertuang dalam visi serta misinya.Dalam upaya mewujudkan niatnya maju dalam perhelatan Calon Anggota Legislatif (Caleg) tersebut, Moh. Hadiwiyono memilih Partai Perindo sebagai kendaraan politiknya dalam Pemilu 2024.“Lewat partai Perindo nomor urut satu Dapil Banggai IV ini insyaallah akan bisa membuka jalan menuju Parlemen Lalong untuk mewujudkan niatnya bagi anak-anak muda lewat magang dan kerja di Jepang,” terangnya.BACA JUGA:Kantor Imigrasi Banggai Gelar Upacara Peringati Hari Bhakti Imigrasi ke 74Ia selalu teringat perkataan dari Presiden pertama Indonesia, Soekarno, yakni “berikan aku 10 pemuda niscaya akan ku guncangkan dunia”.Perkataan tersebut melecut dirinya untuk membantu anak muda supaya dapat berkontribusi bahkan bisa berdaya di luar negeri.Moh Hadiwiyono yang saat ini merupakan ketua umum Himpunan Alumni Magang Jepang (HAM-Japan) dan juga ketua DPW Sulteng Komunitas Penyedia Tenaga Kerja Indonesia (Kapten Indonesia).“Dengan generasi muda Kabupaten Banggai kerja ke Jepang dan sepulangnya dari Jepang, dapat membawa ilmu serta etos kerja orang Jepang agar Luwuk Banggai lebih maju lagi,” ungkapnya.BACA JUGA:Usai Upacara, Kanim Banggai Gelar Syukuran Suksesnya Rangkaian Hari Bhakti Imigrasi ke 74Selain itu ia pun tidak lupa akan membantu menyelesaikan permasalahan yang terjadi disektor perikanan dan pertanian yaitu sering kesulitan dalam mendapatkan subsidi pupuk sehingganya dapat menghambat kemajuan petani.Ia pun berjanji akan melawan money politik dan akan memberikan pemahaman kepada masyarakat menjadi pemilih yang cerdas dimana kita memilih calon anggota legislatif (Caleg) yang bisa memperjuangkan aspirasi kita selama 5 tahun kedepan untuk kemakmuran bersama. AGK
text_en: BANGGAI RAYA- Moh Hadiwiyono is running as a legislative candidate for the Banggai Regency DPRD from the Perindo party, serial number 1, Dapil Banggai IV, covering the districts of Kintom, Batui, South Batui, Moilong, Toili and West Toili. Born in Pasir Lamba Village, Toili District, Banggai Regency, with experience His internship in Japan from 1997 to 2007 made him feel called to run for the 2024 legislative election. What made his desire to move forward was to create a young generation of Banggai who are independent, creative, disciplined, competent and have the competitiveness to become entrepreneurs and businesses to increase employment opportunities in Banggai Regency. READ ALSO: Gisel, Lecturer at FISIP Unismuh Luwuk Passes and is Funded to Participate in the World Youth Festival in Russia Optimizing opportunities for internship and work programs in Japan and will facilitate prospective participants until they finish and return to become entrepreneurs in their respective fields, and will also raise and Elevating the people's economy (UMKM), then increasing tourism, arts, culture and sports, apart from that, it will advance the village economy through the agricultural and fisheries sectors, all of which are stated in its vision and mission. In an effort to realize its intention to advance in the Legislative Member Candidate (Caleg) event, Moh. Hadiwiyono chose the Perindo Party as his political vehicle in the 2024 elections. "Through the Perindo party number one in the Banggai IV electoral district, God willing, we will be able to open the way to the Lalong Parliament to realize its intentions for young people through internships and work in Japan," he explained. READ ALSO : Immigration Office is Proud to Hold a Ceremony to Commemorate the 74th Immigration Service Day. He always remembers the words of Indonesia's first President, Soekarno, namely "give me 10 young people and I will definitely shake the world". These words spurred him to help young people so they can contribute and even be empowered in abroad. Moh Hadiwiyono who is currently the general chairman of the Japanese Internship Alumni Association (HAM-Japan) and also chairman of the Central Sulawesi DPW Indonesian Workforce Provider Community (Captain Indonesia). "With the young generation of Banggai Regency working in Japan and returning from Japan, we can "I will bring Japanese knowledge and work ethic so that Luwuk Banggai will be even more advanced," he said. ALSO READ: After the Ceremony, Kanim Banggai Holds a Celebration of Success in the 74th Immigration Bhakti Day Series. Apart from that, he also doesn't forget to help resolve problems that occur in the fisheries and agriculture sectors, namely There are often difficulties in getting fertilizer subsidies, so this can hinder the progress of farmers. He also promised to fight money politics and provide understanding to the public to become intelligent voters, where we choose legislative candidates (Candidates) who can fight for our aspirations for the next 5 years for shared prosperity. . AGK

title: Jumat Curhat Polres Banggai Bersama Awak Media, Bahas Informasi Dan Isu Terkini
text: Terasbanggai.com-Polres Banggai mengelar Jumat Curhat bersama insan pers yang berlangsung di warung Kopi Bakoel, Lapangan Menembak KM 5 Kelurahan Tanjung Tuwis, Luwuk Selatan, Jumat (26/1/2024). Dalam kegiatan tersebut dihadiri Kabagops Kompol Esti Prasetyo Hadi, didampingi Kasat Lantas AKP I Made bagus Aditya, Kasat Intelkam AKP Usman, Kasat Narkoba IPTU I Gede Wira Hendana dan Kasihums IPTU Al Amin. Serta dihadiri pula Ketua Persatuan Wartawan Indonesia (PWI) Banggai beserta anggota. Acara ini bertujuan menciptakan ruang dialog terbuka berbagi informasi dan pendapat mengenai isu-isu terkini yang berkaitan dengan keamanan antara pihak kepolisian dan insan pers yang ada di Kabupaten Banggai. Kabagops Kompol Esti Prasetyo Hadi menyampaikan terkait pengamanan pemilu, Polri menyiapakan 3 pola yakni kurang rawan, rawan dan sangat rawan. “Untuk daerah sangat rawan seperti TPS di Desa Baloa Doda dan Desa Dolom yaitu rawan bencana alam serta jarak tempuh dan kondisi. Kemudian TPS di dalam Lapas Kelas II B Luwuk,” ujarnya. Lanjut Kabagops, untuk pengamanan TPS kategori sangat rawan ini Polres Banggai menyiapkan 2 personel, 2 linmas untuk 1 TPS. “Kami menyiapakn 421 personil Polres Banggai dan 82 BKO Polda Sulteng untuk mensukseskan Pemilu 2024,” katanya. Sementara itu Kasat Lantas menjelaskan untuk memberantas pengunaan knalpot yang tidak sesuai spesifikasi (brong) dan truck melebihi kapasitas salah satunya dengan menerapkan program “Live Location”. “Begitu pula bagi kendaraan yang parkir sembarangan, mulai minggu depan Satlantas Polres Banggai akan menerapkan program “Sebar Pasang”. Tidak kalah penting, Kasat Narkoba juga mengutarakan komitmennya dalam memberantas peredaran narkotika di Kabupaten Banggai. “Melawan Narkoba adalah investasi dalam masa depan negara kita. Melawan narkoba kita membantu pastikan generasi mendatang memiliki kesempatan hidup sehat dan produktif,” sebutnya. Di tempat yang sama, Ketua PWI Banggai, Iskandar Djiada mengatakan, apa yang menjadi saran dan masukan dari insan pers saat ini kiranya menjadi bahan pertimbangan untuk pengambilan keputusan dalam menjaga sitkamtibmas. “Hendaknya Polres Banggai dapat melaksanakan Rakor Lintas Sektoral bersama Pemda yakni Dishub, PUPR dan intansi terkait lainnya terkait kapasitas jalan, parkiran, dan rambu lalu lintas”, terangnya. Dalam kegiatan tersebut dihadiri Kabagops Kompol Esti Prasetyo Hadi, didampingi Kasat Lantas AKP I Made bagus Aditya, Kasat Intelkam AKP Usman, Kasat Narkoba IPTU I Gede Wira Hendana dan Kasihums IPTU Al Amin. Di tempat yang sama, Ketua PWI Banggai, Iskandar Djiada mengatakan, apa yang menjadi saran dan masukan dari insan pers saat ini kiranya menjadi bahan pertimbangan untuk pengambilan keputusan dalam menjaga sitkamtibmas. “Hendaknya Polres Banggai dapat melaksanakan Rakor Lintas Sektoral bersama Pemda yakni Dishub, PUPR dan intansi terkait lainnya terkait kapasitas jalan, parkiran, dan rambu lalu lintas”, terangnya. “Hendaknya Polres Banggai dapat melaksanakan Rakor Lintas Sektoral bersama Pemda yakni Dishub, PUPR dan intansi terkait lainnya terkait kapasitas jalan, parkiran, dan rambu lalu lintas”, terangnya.
text_en: Terasbanggai.com-The Banggai Police held a Friday Confidation with members of the press which took place at the Bakoel Coffee shop, KM 5 Shooting Range, Tanjung Tuwis Village, South Luwuk, Friday (26/1/2024). This activity was attended by Head of Police Commissioner Esti Prasetyo Hadi, accompanied by Head of Traffic Unit AKP I Made Bagus Aditya, Head of Intelligence and Security AKP Usman, Head of Narcotics Unit IPTU I Gede Wira Hendana and Kasihums IPTU Al Amin. It was also attended by the Chairman of the Indonesian Journalists Association (PWI) Banggai and members. This event aims to create a space for open dialogue to share information and opinions regarding current issues related to security between the police and members of the press in Banggai Regency. Kabagops Kompol Esti Prasetyo Hadi said that regarding election security, the National Police has prepared 3 patterns, namely less vulnerable, vulnerable and very vulnerable. "For very vulnerable areas such as the TPS in Baloa Doda Village and Dolom Village, they are prone to natural disasters as well as the distance and conditions. "Then the TPS is in Luwuk Class II B Prison," he said. Kabagops continued, to secure this very vulnerable TPS, the Banggai Police has prepared 2 personnel, 2 linmas for 1 TPS. "We are preparing 421 Banggai Police personnel and 82 Central Sulawesi Regional Police BKOs to make the 2024 elections a success," he said. Meanwhile, the Head of Traffic Police explained that one way to eradicate the use of exhaust that does not meet specifications (brong) and trucks exceeding capacity is by implementing the "Live Location" program. "Similarly, for vehicles that are parked haphazardly, starting next week the Banggai Police Traffic Unit will implement the "Spread the Post" program. No less important, the Narcotics Head also expressed his commitment to eradicating narcotics trafficking in Banggai Regency. “Fighting drugs is an investment in our country's future. "Combating drugs, we help ensure that future generations have the opportunity to live healthy and productive lives," he said. In the same place, the Chairman of PWI Banggai, Iskandar Djiada, said that suggestions and input from members of the press at this time should be taken into consideration for decision making in maintaining the security and order system. "The Banggai Police should be able to carry out a cross-sectoral coordination meeting with the regional government, namely the Department of Transportation, PUPR and other related agencies regarding road capacity, parking and traffic signs," he explained. title: Dihadiri Ratusan Warga, Kabagops Polres Banggai Pimpin Apel Pengamanan Kampanye di Nambo
text: BANGGAI RAYA- Kabag Ops Polres Banggai selaku Karendalops OMB Kompol Esti Prasetyo Hadi pimpin apel pengecekan personel pengamanan (Pam) kampanye rapat umum Pemilu 2024.Kegiatan bertempat dilobi Mapolres Banggai yang diikuti oleh para Kasatgas dan personel yang terlibat dalam Operasi Mantap Brata (OMB) Tinombala 2023-2024.Apel ini dilaksanakan sebagai bagian dari persiapan menghadapi rangkaian kampanye terbuka yang digelar di Lapangan Bola Amir Club Kelurahan Lontio Kecamatan Nambo, Jumat (26/1/2024) pukul 16.00 Wita.BACA JUGA:Usai Upacara, Kanim Banggai Gelar Syukuran Suksesnya Rangkaian Hari Bhakti Imigrasi ke 74Kabag Ops Polres Banggai menyampaikan bahwa apel ini merupakan kesiapan kita sebelum melaksanakan pengamanan giat kampanye rapat umum oleh salah satu Parpol yang akan melaksanakan kegiatan.BACA JUGA:Putri Amalia, Mahasiswi Cantik AMIK Luwuk Finalis Puteri Indonesia 2024 Wakili SultengPengamanan yang akan kita laksanakan guna mengantisipasi adanya gangguan kamtibmas pada pelaksanaan kegiatan kampanye/sosialisasi oleh salah satu Parpol tersebut.“Adapun personil yang terlibat, yakni 13 anggota Polri dan 4 anggota TNI, ditugaskan untuk mengamankan kampanye terbuka yang dihadiri sekitar 200 warga,” katanya.Hal itu pula yang ditekankan Karendal Ops kepada seluruh anggota agar menjaga netralitas. Jangan ada anggota yang melakukan satu tindakan yang cenderung terlibat dalam politik praktis.BACA JUGA:Jalur Maahas Rawan Laka, Polres Banggai Imbau Kendaraan Tak Parkir di Badan Jalan“Tugas kita hanya melakukan pengamanan, diharapkan kesiapan dan profesionalisme personel dapat memberikan kontribusi positif demi kelancaran tahapan Pemilu di Kabupaten Banggai “ ujarnya.(*)
text_en: BANGGAI RAYA- Head of Operations for the Banggai Police as Karendalops OMB Commissioner Esti Prasetyo Hadi led the roll call to check security personnel (Pam) for the 2024 General Election campaign. The activity took place in the lobby of the Banggai Police Headquarters which was attended by the Heads of the Task Force and personnel involved in the Tinombala Mantap Brata (OMB) Operation 2023-2024. This rally was held as part of preparations for a series of open campaigns which were held at the Amir Club Football Field, Lontio Village, Nambo District, Friday (26/1/2024) at 16.00 WITA. Series of the 74th Immigration Service Day. The Head of the Ops Division of the Banggai Police said that this rally was our readiness before carrying out active security for the general meeting campaign by one of the political parties that will carry out the activity. we are carrying it out to anticipate any disruption to social security and social security in the implementation of campaign/socialization activities by one of the political parties. "The personnel involved, namely 13 members of the National Police and 4 members of the TNI, were assigned to secure the open campaign which was attended by around 200 residents," he said. Karendal Ops also emphasized to all members to maintain neutrality. No member should take any action that tends to be involved in practical politics. ALSO READ: Maahas Route Prone to Accidents, Banggai Police Urges Vehicles Not to Park on the Road "Our job is only to provide security, it is hoped that the readiness and professionalism of personnel can make a positive contribution to the smooth running of the stages "Elections in Banggai Regency," he said.(*)

title: Polres Banggai Identifikasi TPS Sangat Rawan Jelang Voting Day Pemilu 2024
text: Laporan Wartawan TribunPalu.com, Asnawi Zikri TRIBUNPALU.COM, BANGGAI - PolresBanggai mengelar Jumat Curhat bersama awak media di warung kopi Bakoel, Lapangan Menembak KM 5 Kelurahan Tanjung Tuwis, Luwuk Selatan, KabupatenBanggai , Sulawesi Tengah, Jumat (26/1/2024). Kegiatan tersebut dihadiri Kabagops Kompol Esti Prasetyo Hadi, didampingi Kasat Lantas AKP I Made bagus Aditya, Kasat Intelkam AKP Usman, Kasat Narkoba Iptu I Gede Wira Hendana, dan Kasihums IPTU Al Amin. Acara ini bertujuan untuk menciptakan ruang dialog terbuka berbagi informasi dan pendapat mengenai isu-isu terkini yang berkaitan dengan keamanan antara pihak kepolisian dan insan pers yang ada di Kabupaten Banggai. Kabagops Kompol Esti Prasetyo Hadi menyampaikan terkait Pemilu, Polri menyiapakan 3 pola pengamanan, yakni kurang rawan, rawan, dan sangat rawan. “Untuk TPS sangat rawan TPS adaa di Desa Baloa Doda dan Desa Dolom karena rawan bencana alam serta jarak tempuh dan kondisi alam. Kemudian TPS di dalam Lapas Kelas II B Luwuk,” ungkapnya. Lanjut Kabagops, untuk pengamanan TPS kategori sangat rawan, PolresBanggai menyiapkan 2 personel, 2 linmas untuk 1 TPS. “Kami menyiapakn 421 personil PolresBanggai dan 82 BKO Polda Sulteng untuk mensukseskan Pemilu2024 ,” katanya. (*)
text_en: Report from TribunPalu.com Journalist, Asnawi Zikri TRIBUNPALU.COM, BANGGAI - Banggai Police held a Friday Confidential with media crew at the Bakoel coffee shop, KM 5 Shooting Range, Tanjung Tuwis Village, South Luwuk, Banggai Regency, Central Sulawesi, Friday (26/1/2024) . This activity was attended by Head of Police Commissioner Esti Prasetyo Hadi, accompanied by Head of Traffic Unit AKP I Made Bagus Aditya, Head of Intelligence and Security AKP Usman, Head of Narcotics Head Inspector I Gede Wira Hendana, and Kasihums IPTU Al Amin. This event aims to create a space for open dialogue to share information and opinions regarding current issues related to security between the police and members of the press in Banggai Regency. Kabagops Kompol Esti Prasetyo Hadi said that regarding the election, the National Police prepared 3 security patterns, namely less vulnerable, vulnerable and very vulnerable. "The TPS are very vulnerable. The TPS are in Baloa Doda Village and Dolom Village because they are prone to natural disasters as well as the distance and natural conditions. "Then the TPS is in the Luwuk Class II B Prison," he said. Kabagops continued, to secure TPS in the very vulnerable category, Banggai Police prepared 2 personnel, 2 linmas for 1 TPS. "We are preparing 421 Banggai Police personnel and 82 Central Sulawesi Police BKOs to make the 2024 Election a success," he said. (*)

title: KPU Banggai Mulai Kemas Logistik Pemilu, Target Distribusi ke Kecamatan H-6 Voting Day
text: Laporan Wartawan TribunPalu.com, Asnawi Zikri TRIBUNPALU.COM, BANGGAI - Komisi Pemilihan Umum (KPU) KabupatenBanggai , SulawesiTengah , mulai mengemas LogistikPemilu 2024, Sabtu (27/1/2024). Komisioner KPUBanggai Mahmud menyebutkan, pengemasan atau setting logistik untuk menempatkan LogistikPemilu dalam kotak kemudian didistribusikan ke 23 kecamatan se KabupatenBanggai . "Pengesetan logistik itu memuat surat suara ke dalam sampul dan kemudian dimasukan ke dalam kotak suara," jelas Mahmud. Ia menjelaskan, terdapat tiga sampul yang disediakan di setiap TPS untuk jumlah pemilih 300 orang. Setiap sampul terdiri dari 100 surat suara. Proses pengesetan ini, kata Mahmud, memakan waktu cukup lama. Itu karena KPUBanggai memastikan setiap kotak suara berisi Logistik KPU sesuai dengan kebutuhan TPS. KPU Banggai menargetkan, semua LogistikPemilu sudah terdistribusi ke semua kecamatan H-6 voting day atau pemungutan suara. "Kalau waktunya tidak memungkinkan, kami akan menambah personel untuk proses pengesetan. Untuk saat ini, kami libatkan pegawai internal KPUBanggai ," ucap Mahmud.(*)
text_en: Report from TribunPalu.com Journalist, Asnawi Zikri TRIBUNPALU.COM, BANGGAI - The General Election Commission (KPU) of Banggai Regency, Central Sulawesi, started packaging the 2024 Election Logistics, Saturday (27/1/2024). Banggai KPU Commissioner Mahmud said that the packaging or logistics settings for placing election logistics in boxes were then distributed to 23 sub-districts throughout Banggai Regency. "The logistics setup involves placing the ballot paper in an envelope and then placing it in the ballot box," explained Mahmud. He explained that there were three covers provided at each TPS for a total of 300 voters. Each envelope consists of 100 ballots. This setup process, said Mahmud, took quite a long time. That's because KPU Banggai ensures that each ballot box contains KPU logistics according to the needs of the polling station. The Banggai KPU targets that all election logistics have been distributed to all sub-districts on the 6th of voting day or voting. "If time doesn't allow, we will add personnel for the setup process. For now, we are involving internal KPU Banggai employees," said Mahmud.(*)

title: Selamat! 4 Mahasiswa FKM Untika Luwuk Lolos 3 Program MBKM
text: BANGGAI RAYA-Selamat, empat mahasiswa Fakultas Kesehatan Masyarakat (FKM) Universitas Tompotika (Untika) Luwuk berhasil lolos dalam kompetisi nasional merdeka belajar kampus merdeka.Keempat mahasiswa ini, ada yang lolos kampus mengajar, pertukaran mahasiswa merdeka (PMM) dan lolos magang dan studi independen bersertifikat (MSIB).Dekan FKM Untika Luwuk, Ramli A. Bidullah, SKM.,M.Kes menyampaikan selamat kepada empat mahasiswanya yang lolos dalam kompetisi tersebut.Ia menguraikan, nama-nama mahasiswa yang lolos tersebut.BACA JUGA:Dihadiri Ratusan Warga, Kabagops Polres Banggai Pimpin Apel Pengamanan Kampanye di NamboPertama,  dua mahasiswa yang lolos program Kampus Mengajar yakni Farina Rahman penempatan di SDN Simpong dan Nurafni Labodu di SMK Simpang Raya.Kemudian, satu mahasiswa lolos Pertukaran Mahasiswa Merdeka (PMM) atas nama Sukmawati Nang. Ia akan ditempatkan diUniversitas Dian Nuswantoro.Sementara yang keempat, Sri Lastri Usman. Ia lolos dalam program Magang dan Studi Independen Bersertifikat (MSIB).Sri Lastri Usman akan melakukan magang di Dinas Kesehatan Kota Surabaya.BACA JUGA:Gisel, Dosen FISIP Unismuh Luwuk Lolos dan Dibiayai Ikuti Festival Pemuda Dunia di Rusia“Sebagai Dekan, saya mengucapkan selamat dan sangat mengapresiasi apa yang dicapai mereka dan beberpa mahasiswa sebelumnya yang juga lolos dan memgikuti kegiatan MBKM khususnya Program Flagship yang sepenuhnya dibiayai Kementerian,” ucap Dekan Ramli Bidullah.Ia berharap, mehasiswa yang lolos dapat mengikuti kegiatan MBKM ini dengan penuh keseriusan sehingga mendapatkan seluruh manfaat dari program ini.“Saya juga berharap mahasiswa lain kedepan dapat termotivasi untuk memgikuti MBKM. Saya sebagai Dekan juga sedang mengupayakan Reward yang akan diberikan kepada mereka yang lolos mengikuti MBKM ini,” tuturnya, mengapresiasi.BACA JUGA:Pengamanan Pemilu, Polres Banggai Kerahkan 421 Personil dan 61 BKO PoldaIa menambahkan, dari seluruh Fakultas yang ada di Untika, hanya FKM yang Lolos ketiga Program MBKM tersebut. Baik itu Pertukaran Mahasiswa, Magang dan Studi Independen Bersertifikat, dan Kampus Mengajar. Capaian ini tentunya patut diapresiasi dan diacungi jempol. (*)
text_en: BANGGAI RAYA-Congratulations, four students from the Faculty of Public Health (FKM) Tompotika University (Untika) Luwuk have successfully passed the national independent learning competition at independent campuses. These four students, some of whom passed the teaching campus, independent student exchange (PMM) and passed internships and studies certified independent (MSIB). Dean of FKM Untika Luwuk, Ramli A. Bidullah, SKM., M.Kes congratulated the four students who passed the competition. He explained the names of the students who passed. ALSO READ: Hundreds of residents attended , Kabagops Banggai Police Leads Campaign Security Call in Nambo. First, two students who passed the Teaching Campus program, namely Farina Rahman, were placed at SDN Simpong and Nurafni Labodu at SMK Simpang Raya. Then, one student passed the Independent Student Exchange (PMM) in the name of Sukmawati Nang. He will be placed at Dian Nuswantoro University. Meanwhile the fourth, Sri Lastri Usman. She passed the Certified Independent Study and Internship (MSIB) program. Sri Lastri Usman will undertake an internship at the Surabaya City Health Service. READ ALSO: Gisel, Lecturer at FISIP Unismuh Luwuk Passes and is Funded to Participate in the World Youth Festival in Russia "As Dean, I congratulate and really appreciate what they and several previous students have achieved who also passed and took part in MBKM activities, especially the Flagship Program which is fully funded by the Ministry," said Dean Ramli Bidullah. He hopes that students who pass can take part in these MBKM activities with full seriousness so that they get all the benefits. from this program. "I also hope that other students in the future can be motivated to take part in MBKM. "I, as Dean, am also working on a reward that will be given to those who pass the MBKM," he said, appreciating it. ALSO READ: Election Security, Banggai Police Deploys 421 Personnel and 61 Regional Police BKOs. He added, of all the Faculties in Untika, only FKM who passed the three MBKM programs. Be it Student Exchange, Certified Independent Study and Internship, and Teaching Campus. This achievement certainly deserves appreciation and thumbs up. (*)

title: Putri Amalia, Mahasiswi Cantik AMIK Luwuk Finalis Puteri Indonesia 2024 Wakili Sulteng
text: BANGGAI RAYA- Selamat, prestasi membanggakan ditorehkan mahasiswi cantik asal AMIK Luwuk Banggai.Ia adalah Putri Amalia, mahasiswi Komputerisasi Akuntansi yang sukses menjadi finalis Puteri Indonesia 2024 mewakili Sulawesi Tengah (Sulteng).Putri Amalia, sebelumnya juga saat ini menyandang sebagai Putri Pariwisata Banggai Laut (Balut) tahun 2023.Prestasi demi prestasi terus diraihnya, dan saat ini Ia berhasil menjadi finalis di ajang Putri Indonesia tahun 2024 mewakili Provinsi Sulteng.“Kenalkan nama saya Putri Amalia, usia 20 tahun. Kesibukan saya sebagai mahasiswi di salah satu perguruan tinggi di Kabupaten Banggai yakni AMIK Luwuk Banggai,” ucap gadis cantik yang merupakan buah hati pasangan dari Ajania Sadam (Adean) dan  ayah Awaludin Moidady dalam tayangan video singkat.BACA JUGA:Moh Hadiwiyono, Alumni Magang Jepang Nyaleg DPRD BanggaiIa menjelaskan, kuliah di perguruan tinggi berbasis IT, memilih jurusan akuntansi.“Alasan saya mengikuti ajang Putri Indonesia ini sebagai motivasi untuk teman-teman agar mau lebih mencintai dirinya sendiri,” katanya.Berikut profil lengkap, Putri Amalia Moidady yang kini berusia 20 tahun.BACA JUGA:Gisel, Dosen FISIP Unismuh Luwuk Lolos dan Dibiayai Ikuti Festival Pemuda Dunia di RusiaPutri Amalia yang memiliki tinggi badan 170 Cm itu, merupakan mahasiswi semester empat Prodi Akuntansi di Akademi Manajemen Informatika dan Komputer (AMIK) Luwuk Banggai.Putri Amalia Moidady adalah anak pasangan dari Ajania Sadam (Adean) dan  ayah Awaludin Moidady.Gadis cantik 20 tahun itu, pernah mewakili Kabupaten Banggai Laut di Paskibraka tingkat Provinsi Sulawesi Tengah.Sementara untuk riwayat pendidikan, Putri Amalia mengenyam pendidikan di Bangku SD Inpres Adean, kemudian SMP Negeri Peling Tengah, dan melanjutkan sekolah di SMA Negeri 1 Banggai.BACA JUGA:Usai Upacara, Kanim Banggai Gelar Syukuran Suksesnya Rangkaian Hari Bhakti Imigrasi ke 74Saat ini, finalis Puteri Indonesia tahun 2024 mewakili Sulawesi Tengah itu tercatat aktif sebagai mahasiswa AMIK Luwuk Banggai.Atas prestasi yang membanggakan, Putri Amali mendapat apresiasi setinggi-tingginya dari Direktur AMIK Luwuk Banggai, Heriyanto Sahidu S.Sos., S.Kom, MM.“Tentunya kami civitas akademika sangat berterima kasih kepada Putri, telah membawa nama AMIK Luwuk di ajang bergengsi dan level nasional,” ucap Direktur Heriyanto Sahidu memberi apresiasi. (*)
text_en: BANGGAI RAYA- Congratulations, a beautiful achievement has been made by a beautiful student from AMIK Luwuk Banggai. She is Putri Amalia, a Computerized Accounting student who successfully became a finalist for Puteri Indonesia 2024 representing Central Sulawesi (Central Sulawesi). Putri Amalia, previously also currently holds the title of Princess of Banggai Laut Tourism (Balut) in 2023. She continues to achieve achievement after achievement, and currently she has succeeded in becoming a finalist in the Miss Indonesia event in 2024 representing Central Sulawesi Province. "My name is Putri Amalia, 20 years old. "I'm busy as a student at one of the universities in Banggai Regency, namely AMIK Luwuk Banggai," said the beautiful girl who is the daughter of Ajania Sadam (Adean) and Awaludin Moidady's father in a short video. READ ALSO: Moh Hadiwiyono, Japanese Internship Alumni Nyaleg DPRD BanggaiHe explained that he studied at an IT-based college, choosing to major in accounting. "The reason I took part in the Miss Indonesia event was as motivation for my friends to love themselves more," he said. The following is the complete profile of Putri Amalia Moidady, who is now aged 20 years old. READ ALSO: Gisel, Lecturer at FISIP Unismuh Luwuk Passes and is Funded to Participate in the World Youth Festival in Russia. Princess Amalia, who is 170 cm tall, is a fourth semester student of the Accounting Study Program at the Luwuk Banggai Academy of Information and Computer Management (AMIK). Moidady is the son of Ajania Sadam (Adean) and father Awaludin Moidady. This beautiful 20 year old girl once represented Banggai Laut Regency in Paskibraka at the Central Sulawesi Province level. Meanwhile, for educational history, Princess Amalia received her education at Inpres Adean Elementary School, then Middle School. Negeri Peling Tengah, and continued his studies at SMA Negeri 1 Banggai. READ ALSO: After the Ceremony, Kanim Banggai Holds a Celebration of Success in the 74th Immigration Bhakti Day Series. Currently, the finalist for Puteri Indonesia in 2024 representing Central Sulawesi is registered as an active student at AMIK Luwuk Banggai. Above A proud achievement, Putri Amali received the highest appreciation from the Director of AMIK Luwuk Banggai, Heriyanto Sahidu S.Sos., S.Kom, MM. "Of course, we, the academic community, are very grateful to Putri, for bringing the name of AMIK Luwuk to this prestigious event and national level," said Director Heriyanto Sahidu with appreciation. (*)

title: Bupati Banggai Dorong Perlindungan Hak Kekayaan Intelektual Pelaku Usaha Kerajinan
text: Laporan Wartawan TribunPalu.com, Asnawi Zikri TRIBUNPALU.COM, BANGGAI - BupatiBanggai , Amirudin , menorong upaya perlindungan HakKekayaanIntelektual bagi pelaku usaha kerajinan. “Pihak BRIDA sudah memasukan dalam APBD, bahwa teman-teman yang akan memasukan hasil temuannya ke HakKekayaanIntelektual itu gratis,” ujar Bupati Amirudin , Sabtu (27/1/2924). Hal itu disampaikan dalam kegiatan yang diselenggarakan oleh Dewan Kerajinan Nasional Daerah (Dekranasda) Kabupaten Banggai dalam rangka meningkatkan pemahaman, kreativitas, dan keterampilan dalam mengembangkan usaha kriya/kerajinan. Ketua Dekranasda, Syamsuarni Amirudin , menyatakan, kegiatan ini merupakan langkah awal dalam rangka mengembangkan potensi kriya dan kerajinan di KabupatenBanggai . “Ada beberapa pemateri, mudah-mudahan ini sebagai bagian kita semua untuk menjadi pelajaran kedepan. Sebagai bahan masukan untuk para pelaku usaha yang ada di KabupatenBanggai bisa jauh lebih berkembang,” ujar Ketua Syamsuarni. Pemateri yang akan turut serta dalam pembinaan dan penguatan kapasitas pelaku usaha dan pengrajin tersebut yaitu Ketua Dekranasda, Syamsuarni Amirudin , Kepala Badan Perencanaan Pembangunan Daerah (Bappeda) Banggai Ramli Tongko, dan Sekretaris BRIDA Banggai Iksan Budiono. Dalam mendukung promosi produk kriya dan kerajinan, Bupati Amirudin akan menyediakan tempat kepada pihak Dekranasda di Bandar Udara Syukuran Aminuddin Amir untuk kegiatan pajangan. Hal ini memungkinkan hasil dari produk para pelaku usaha dapat dipamerkan secara lebih luas. Selain itu, Bupati Amirudin melakukan dialog terhadap beberapa peserta mengenai dukungan serta bantuan yang akan diberikan dalam mendukung sektor kriya/kerajinan. “Ada bantuan Rp 5 miliar per kecamatan, itu boleh digunakan untuk kerajinan, karena tujuan kita kasih yaitu supaya menghidupkan semua pelaku usaha yang ada di daerah,” jelas Bupati Amirudin Lanjutnya, Ia menjelaskan terdapat Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) yang terbuka bagi proposal dari pelaku usaha untuk memberikan kesempatan lebih luas dalam menciptakan sinergi antara sektor swasta dan pelaku usaha lokal. Acara ini melibatkan peserta sebanyak 60 orang yang berasal dari 17 kecamatan yang tersebar di wilayah KabupatenBanggai . Adapun jenis pelaku usaha yang terlibat dalam kegiatan ini yaitu usaha batik Saluan, anyaman rotan, anyaman lidi, pandai besi, daur, kerajinan kayu, dan kerajinan bambu. (*)
text_en: Report from TribunPalu.com Journalist, Asnawi Zikri TRIBUNPALU.COM, BANGGAI - The Regent of Banggai, Amirudin, is encouraging efforts to protect Intellectual Property Rights for craft business actors. "BRIDA has included in the APBD that friends who will submit their findings to Intellectual Property Rights are free of charge," said Regent Amirudin, Saturday (27/1/2924). This was conveyed in activities organized by the Regional National Crafts Council (Dekranasda) of Banggai Regency in order to increase understanding, creativity and skills in developing craft/craft businesses. The chairman of Dekranasda, Syamsuarni Amirudin, stated that this activity was the first step in developing the potential of crafts and crafts in Banggai Regency. "There are several presenters, hopefully this will be a lesson for all of us in the future. "As input for business actors in Banggai Regency, they can develop much more," said Chairman Syamsuarni. The speakers who will take part in coaching and strengthening the capacity of business actors and craftsmen are the Chair of Dekranasda, Syamsuarni Amirudin, the Head of the Banggai Regional Development Planning Agency (Bappeda) Ramli Tongko, and the Secretary of BRIDA Banggai Iksan Budiono. In supporting the promotion of craft and handicraft products, Regent Amirudin will provide Dekranasda with a place at Syukuran Aminuddin Amir Airport for display activities. This allows the results of business actors' products to be exhibited more widely. Apart from that, Regent Amirudin held a dialogue with several participants regarding the support and assistance that would be provided to support the craft sector. "There is assistance of IDR 5 billion per sub-district, which can be used for crafts, because our aim is to revive all business actors in the area," explained Regent Amirudin. He continued, he explained that there was Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) which was open to proposals from business actors to provide wider opportunities to create synergies between the private sector and local business actors. This event involved 60 participants from 17 sub-districts spread across the Banggai Regency area. The types of business actors involved in this activity are Saluan batik, rattan weaving, stick weaving, blacksmithing, recycling, wood crafts and bamboo crafts. (*)

title: Polisi Tangkap Pelaku Pencurian Ponsel di Desa Lumpoknyo Banggai
text: Laporan Wartawan TribunPalu.com, Asnawi Zikri TRIBUNPALU.COM, BANGGAI -Polres Banggai melalui Tim Resmob Tompotika kembali mengamankan terduga pelaku pencurian telepon seluler atau ponsel di DesaLumpoknyo Kecamatan Luwuk, KabupatenBanggai , Sulawesi Tengah, Jumat (26/1/2024) sore. Pelaku berinisial DI, 19 tahun, itu ditangkap berdasarkan laporan korban DS (29) pada Jumat, 19 Januari 2024 lalu. Kasat Reskrim PolresBanggai AKP Tio Tondy, mengatakan saat itu sekitar pukul 13.00 Wita, anak korban pergi berbelanja ke warung sambil membawa ponsel. Saat kembali ke rumahnya ternyata ponsel itu tertinggal. “Lalu korban kembali mendatangi kios yang dimaksud, akan tetapi ponsel miliknya sudah tidak ada,” ungkap AKP Tio, Sabtu (27/1/2024). Polisi mengetahui identitas dan keberadaan terduga pelaku beserta barang bukti. Ponsel tersebut diketahui aktif di sekitaran DesaLumpoknyo . Tim Resmob langsung mengamankan terduga pelaku DI di rumahnya beserta 1 buah ponsel merk Oppo A31. Setelah pengecekan Imei tersebut ternyata cocok dengan laporan korban. “Dari pengakuan pelaku telah mengakui perbuatannya. Ia dengan sadar mengambil ponsel korban dan berniat ingin memilikinya,” jelas AKP Tio. Terduga pelaku diamankan di Mapolres Banggai untuk menjalani proses hukum lebih lanjut. (*)
text_en: Report from TribunPalu.com Journalist, Asnawi Zikri TRIBUNPALU.COM, BANGGAI - Banggai Police through the Tompotika Resmob Team again arrested the suspected perpetrator of the theft of a cell phone or mobile phone in Lumpoknyo Village, Luwuk District, Banggai Regency, Central Sulawesi, Friday (26/1/2024) afternoon. The perpetrator with the initials DI, 19 years old, was arrested based on a report from victim DS (29) on Friday, January 19 2024. Head of Criminal Investigation Unit for the Banggai Police, AKP Tio Tondy, said that at around 13.00 WITA, the victim's child went shopping at a shop while carrying a cellphone. When he returned to his house he found that he had left his cell phone behind. "Then the victim returned to the kiosk in question, but his cellphone was no longer there," said AKP Tio, Saturday (27/1/2024). The police know the identity and whereabouts of the alleged perpetrator along with evidence. The cellphone is known to be active around Lumpoknyo Village. The Resmob team immediately arrested the suspected DI perpetrator at his house along with an Oppo A31 cellphone. After checking the IMEI, it turned out to match the victim's report. “From the confession, the perpetrator has admitted his actions. "He consciously took the victim's cell phone and intended to have it," explained AKP Tio. The alleged perpetrator was detained at the Banggai Police Headquarters to undergo further legal proceedings. (*)

title: Bupati Banggai Tegaskan Anggaran Rp 5 Miliar Di Kecamatan Bisa Dorong Geliat Pelaku Usaha Kerajinan
text: Terasbanggai.com -Pemerintah daerah berkomitmen terus mendorong pertumbuhan sektor UMKM termasuk para pelaku usaha sektor produk kerajinan di daerah ini. Hal itu ditandaskan Bupati Banggai Amirudin saat mengahdiri kegiatan yang dilaksanakan Dewan Kerajinan Nasional Daerah (Dekranasda) Kabupaten Banggai, Sabtu (27/1/2024) di Ballroom Hotel Santika Luwuk. Bupati Amirudin mengungkapkan pemerintah daerah telah mengalokasikan anggaran APBD sebesar Rp 5 miliar yang tersimpan dalam DPA setiap kecamatan. Sehingga Bupati Banggai menandaskan anggaran tersebut dapat digunakan untuk mendorong UMKM khususnya pelaku usaha kerajinan untuk meningkatkan usahanya. “Ada anggaran Rp 5 miliar per kecamatan, itu boleh digunakan untuk kerajinan, karena tujuan kita kasih yaitu supaya menghidupkan semua pelaku usaha yang ada di daerah,” tutur Bupati Banggai. Bupati Banggai juga mendorong pelaku usaha kerajinan memanfaatkan anggaran pemberdayaan melalui Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) untuk memberikan kesempatan lebih luas dalam menciptakan sinergi antara sektor swasta dan pelaku usaha lokal. Selain itu pemerintah daerah juga menyediakan anggaran bagi pelaku usaha yang ingin melindungi hak cipta kerajinannya untuk mendapatkan sertifikat HAKI (hak kekayaan intelektual) dari Kemenkum HAM RI. “BRIDA sudah memasukan dalam APBD, bahwa teman-teman yang akan memasukan hasil temuannya ke hak kekayaan intelektual itu gratis,” ujar Bupati Amirudin. Sementara itu, Ketua Dekranasda, Syamsuarni Amirudin, menyatakan bahwa kegiatan ini merupakan langkah awal dalam rangka mengembangkan potensi kriya dan kerajinan di Kabupaten Banggai. “Ada beberapa pemateri, mudah – mudahan ini sebagai bagian kita semua untuk menjadi pelajaran kedepan, Sebagai bahan masukan untuk para pelaku usaha yang ada di Kab. Banggai bisa jauh lebih berkembang,” ujar Ketua Dekranasda. Acara ini melibatkan peserta sebanyak 60 orang yang berasal dari 17 kecamatan yang tersebar di wilayah Kabupaten Banggai. Adapun jenis pelaku usaha yang terlibat dalam kegiatan ini yaitu usaha batik Saluan, anyaman rotan, anyaman lidi, pandai besi, daur, kerajinan kayu, dan kerajinan bambu. Sementara itu, Ketua Dekranasda, Syamsuarni Amirudin, menyatakan bahwa kegiatan ini merupakan langkah awal dalam rangka mengembangkan potensi kriya dan kerajinan di Kabupaten Banggai. “Ada beberapa pemateri, mudah – mudahan ini sebagai bagian kita semua untuk menjadi pelajaran kedepan, Sebagai bahan masukan untuk para pelaku usaha yang ada di Kab. text_en: Terasbanggai.com - The regional government is committed to continuing to encourage the growth of the MSME sector, including business actors in the craft product sector in this area. This was emphasized by Banggai Regent Amirudin when attending activities carried out by the Regional National Crafts Council (Dekranasda) of Banggai Regency, Saturday (27/1/2024) in the Ballroom of the Santika Luwuk Hotel. Regent Amirudin revealed that the regional government had allocated an APBD budget of IDR 5 billion which was stored in the DPA for each sub-district. So the Regent of Banggai emphasized that the budget could be used to encourage MSMEs, especially craft business actors, to improve their businesses. "There is a budget of Rp. 5 billion per sub-district, which can be used for crafts, because our aim is to revive all business actors in the area," said the Regent of Banggai. The Regent of Banggai also encouraged craft business actors to utilize the empowerment budget through Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) to provide wider opportunities to create synergy between the private sector and local business actors. Apart from that, the regional government also provides a budget for business actors who want to protect the copyright of their crafts to obtain an IPR (intellectual property rights) certificate from the Indonesian Ministry of Law and Human Rights. "BRIDA has included in the APBD that friends who will include their findings in intellectual property rights are free," said Regent Amirudin. Meanwhile, the Chair of Dekranasda, Syamsuarni Amirudin, stated that this activity was the first step in developing the potential of crafts and crafts in Banggai Regency. "There are several presenters, hopefully this will be a lesson for all of us in the future, as input for business actors in the district. "Proud to be able to develop much more," said the Chairman of Dekranasda. This event involved 60 participants from 17 sub-districts spread across the Banggai Regency area. The types of business actors involved in this activity are Saluan batik, rattan weaving, stick weaving, blacksmithing, recycling, wood crafts and bamboo crafts.
