text_en: Terasbanggai.com- Pertamina EP and the Special Task Force for Upstream Oil and Gas Business Activities (SKK Migas) drilled the Julang Emas exploration well (JLE)-001 at the exploration drilling location in Banggai Regency, Central Sulawesi. This onshore drilling was carried out on Tuesday, January 30 2024 and is part of a series of exploration in Central Indonesia in the Sulawesi region which previously carried out drilling work on the East Wolai (EWO)-001 and West Wolai (WWO)-001 Explorations in the fourth quarter of 2023. This effort was carried out by SKK Migas and KKKS in order to find new oil and gas reserves or Giant Discovery to meet national energy needs. The Julang Emas Well (JLE)-001 is located in the Donggi field, precisely in Banggai Regency, Central Sulawesi. The exploration well will be drilled in a directional manner using Rig PDSI #04.3 with a planned final depth of the well in the 2000s mMD (meters measured depth). This exploration drilling is intended to test and screen potential oil and gas deposits with proven resources of approximately 40 MMBOE (Million Barrels of Oil Equivalent) from 2 target formations. The exploration well drilling program is planned for approximately 80 days until the production test is completed. Head of the SKK Migas Program and Communications Division, Hudi D Suryodipuro, said that SKK Migas hopes that the drilling of the Julang Emas (JLE)-001 well can find massive oil and gas reserves, thereby making a real contribution to the country in supporting the 1 Million Barrels (BOPD) and 12 Billion programs. cubic feet of gas (BSCFD) in 2030. Hudi said that this activity would be an extraordinary starting point, in early 2024, because massive exploration could certainly have a positive impact and efforts would be made to increase national oil and gas production. Hudi added that exploration or exploration in the Sulawesi region is currently being intensively carried out because Sulawesi has large oil and gas potential. title: IHK di Kota Luwuk Alami Inflasi, Begini Rilis Lengkap BPS
text: BANGGAI RAYA- Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS) Kabupaten Banggai merilis terkait perkembangan Indeks Harga Konsumen (IHK) Luwuk, pada Kamis 1 Februari 2024.Dalam rilis tersebut, Kepala BPS Banggai, Ir. Muhammad Said, Msc, memaparkan terjadinya kenaikan IHK di kota Luwuk pada awal tahun  2024.Di mana inflasi bulan ke bulan atau Januari 2024 terhadap Desember 2023 mengalami inflasi 0,27 persen.BPS juga mencatat inflasi dari tahun ke tahun atau Januari 2024 terhadap Januari 2023 mengalami 3,35 persen.BACA JUGA:Buah Tangan Ustadz Iswan, Kini Warga BTN Bukit Mambual Regency Miliki MasjidSementara itu, berdasarkan inflasi tahun kalender, dari Januari 2024 terhadap Desember 2023 mengalami 0,27 persen.Dikatakan Muhammad Said, bahwa penyumbang utama inflasi pada bulan Januari 2024 secara bulan ke bulan adalah kelompok perumahan, air, listrik dan bahan bakar rumah tangga, dengan andil 0,19 persen.BACA JUGA:Pantau Persiapan Pemilu, Bupati Banggai Kunjungi KPU Banggai“Untuk komoditas penyumbang utama inflasi, di antaranya,  kontrak rumah, susu bubuk untuk balita, bawang, bawang merah dan ikan selar atau ikan tude,”ucapnya.Tak hanya itu, Kepala BPS Banggai juga menyampaikan penyumbang inflasi bulan Januari 2024 secara tahun ke tahun.Penyumbang inflasi secara tahun ke tahun ini, kata dia, yaitu pada kelompok makanan, minuman dan tembakau dengan andil 1,80 persen. Dan Penyumbang terbesar dalam kelompok ini adalah beras.BACA JUGA:Curi Receiver CCTV dan Wifi, Pria Asal Maahas Dibekuk PolisiSelanjutnya pada kelompok perumahan, air, listrik dan bahan bakar rumah tangga, dengan andil 0,50 persen. Di mana, penyumbang inflasi terbesar dalam kelompok ini adalah bahan bakar rumah tangga.Kemudian pada kelompok penyediaan makanan dan minuman atau restoran, dengan andil 0,35 persen. Dalam kelompok ini  penyumbang inflasi terbesar adalah nasi dan lauk. AGK
text_en: BANGGAI RAYA- The Banggai Regency Central Statistics Agency (BPS) released developments regarding the Luwuk Consumer Price Index (CPI), on Thursday 1 February 2024. In this release, the Head of BPS Banggai, Ir. Muhammad Said, MSc, explained that there would be an increase in the CPI in the city of Luwuk at the beginning of 2024. Where month-on-month inflation or January 2024 against December 2023 experienced inflation of 0.27 percent. experienced 3.35 percent. ALSO READ: The souvenir of Ustadz Iswan, now residents of BTN Bukit Mambual Regency have a mosque. Meanwhile, based on calendar year inflation, from January 2024 to December 2023 it experienced 0.27 percent. Muhammad Said said that the main contributor to inflation in January 2024 on a month-to-month basis is the housing, water, electricity and household fuel group, with a share of 0.19 percent. READ ALSO: Monitoring Election Preparations, Banggai Regent Visits Banggai KPU "For commodities that are the main contributor to inflation, among them, contracts house, powdered milk for toddlers, onions, shallots and trevally or tude fish," he said. Not only that, the Head of BPS Banggai also conveyed the contributors to inflation in January 2024 on a year-on-year basis. Contributors to inflation on a year-on-year basis, he said , namely in the food, beverage and tobacco group with a share of 1.80 percent. And the biggest contributor in this group is rice. READ ALSO: Stealing CCTV and Wifi Receivers, Man from Maahas Arrested by Police. Next in the housing, water, electricity and household fuel group, with a share of 0.50 percent. Where, the biggest contributor to inflation in this group is household fuel. Then in the food and beverage or restaurant provision group, with a contribution of 0.35 percent. In this group the biggest contributor to inflation is rice and side dishes. AGK

title: Gudang Alumunium Kompleks Pertokoan Luwuk Terbakar
text: BANGGAI RAYA-Satu gudang bahan aluminium di Jalan Teuku Umar No. 90 kompleks Pertokoan Kelurahan Luwuk, Kabupaten Banggai mengalami kebakaran, Jumat (2/2/2024) sekitar pukul 10.30 Wita.Plt Kapolsek Luwuk AKP Steven Lewaherillah mengungkapkan, dari keterangan seorang saksi Ibu Andui melihat kemunculan titik api di bagian samping bangunan gudang milik Donal Dusia (40) warga Jalan Jendral Ahmad Yani Luwuk (Toko Mas Jawa).BACA JUGA:Truk Pengangkut 10 Ton Raskin Terperosok Selokan di Pagimana“Titik api muncul dari tumpukan gabus ikan tepat disamping bangunan Gudang tersebut. Pemiliknya adalah Handies Umaiyer,” ungkapnya.BACA JUGA:IHK di Kota Luwuk Alami Inflasi, Begini Rilis Lengkap BPSSementara itu, kata Steven, menyebutkan bahwa saat itu saksi lain mendengar teriakan dan keluar melihat api sudah membesar di bagian samping gudang. Sehingga langsung menghubungi pemadam kebakaran.“Api cepat dipadamkan sehingga tidak meluas. Hanya dibagian samping saja yang terbakar,” sebutnya.BACA JUGA:Curi Receiver CCTV dan Wifi, Pria Asal Maahas Dibekuk PolisiIa menambahkan, kerugian material dalam peristiwa tersebut belum dapat dipastikan dan tidak terdapat korban jiwa.“Untuk dugaan terjadinya kebakaran juga belum dapat dipastikan, nanti akan kami sampaikan kembali, selepas anggota memeriksa para saksi,” pungkasnya. (*)
text_en: BANGGAI RAYA-An aluminum warehouse on Jalan Teuku Umar No. 90 shopping complexes in Luwuk Village, Banggai Regency experienced a fire, Friday (2/2/2024) at around 10.30 WITA. Acting Luwuk Police Chief AKP Steven Lewaherillah revealed that, from the testimony of a witness, Mrs. Andui saw the appearance of fire spots on the side of Donal Dusia's warehouse building. (40) resident of Jalan Jendral Ahmad Yani Luwuk (Toko Mas Jawa). READ ALSO: Truck Carrying 10 Tons of Raskin Falls into a Ditch in Pagimana "The fire point emerged from a pile of fish corks right next to the warehouse building. "The owner is Handies Umaiyer," he said. READ ALSO: CPI in Luwuk City Experiences Inflation, Here's the Complete BPSS Release. Meanwhile, said Steven, saying that at that time another witness heard screams and came out to see the fire already growing at the side of the warehouse. So he immediately contacted the fire department. "The fire was quickly extinguished so it didn't spread. "Only the side part was burned," he said. ALSO READ: Stealing CCTV and Wifi Receiver, Man from Maahas Arrested by Police He added that material losses in this incident could not be ascertained and there were no casualties. "We will convey it again later, after members have examined the witnesses," he concluded. (*)

title: 583 Peserta Ramaikan Turnamen Badminton di Banggai, Perebutkan Hadiah Rp 40 Juta
text: Laporan Wartawan TribunPalu.com, Asnawi Zikri TRIBUNPALU.COM, BANGGAI - Bupati Banggai, Amirudin, membuka acara Badminton Open Tournament Bupati Cup, di GOR Kilongan, Kecamatan Luwuk Utara, KabupatenBanggai , Sulawesi Tengah, Kamis (1/2/2024). Turnamen ini menjadi ajang yang dinantikan para pecinta bulu tangkis di KabupatenBanggai , serta menjadi wadah untuk menumbuhkan semangat kompetisi dan kebersamaan dalam olahraga. "Pertama saya sangat bangga dengan antusias daripada atlet pada malam hari ini luar biasa kurang lebih 500 lebih peserta," tutur Bupati Amirudin. Karena antusiasme yang cukup besar, turnamen badminton ini direncanakan akan dilaksanakan setahun dua kali. "Malam hari ini adalah putaran yang pertama, dan Insya Allah putaran keduanya kita laksanakan di bulan Juli," tandas Bupati Amirudin. Bupati Amirudin mengaku turnamen sangat penting karena sebagai ajang menyiapkan atlet muda KabupatenBanggai untuk bisa mewakili Sulawesi Tengah di ajang nasional. Sebab, turnamen kali ini tk hanya melibatkan atlet Banggai, tetapi juga diikuti atlet luar daerah "Ini motivasi untuk kita semua melihat para atlet-atlet berprestasi sehingga ke depan adik-adik kita bisa mengikuti jejak mereka yang sebentar akan kita saksikan bersama," jelas Bupati Amirudin. Bupati Amirudin juga menyatakan junjung tinggi sportifitas, dan menjadikan turnamen ini tidak hanya sebagai ajang kompetisi, tetapi juga sebagai sarana memperkokoh persaudaraan di antara pecinta bulu tangkis KabupatenBanggai . Pada kesempatan yang sama, Ketua Panitia Badminton Open Tournament Bupati Cup, Ridwan T. Polopa menyampaikan adapun jumlah peserta berasal dari Kabupaten/Kota se Sulawesi Tengah sebanyak 583 peserta. "Waktu pelaksanaan dimulai dari tanggal 1 sampai 4 Februari 2024," kata Ridwan Polopa. Para peserta akan memperebutkan hadiah sebesar Rp 40 juta. (*)
text_en: Report from TribunPalu.com Journalist, Asnawi Zikri TRIBUNPALU.COM, BANGGAI - The Regent of Banggai, Amirudin, opened the Badminton Open Tournament Regent Cup, at GOR Kilongan, North Luwuk District, Banggai Regency, Central Sulawesi, Thursday (1/2/2024). This tournament is an event that badminton fans in Banggai Regency have been waiting for, as well as being a forum for fostering a spirit of competition and togetherness in sports. "Firstly, I am very proud of the extraordinary enthusiasm of the athletes tonight, more than 500 participants," said Regent Amirudin. Due to the great enthusiasm, this badminton tournament is planned to be held twice a year. "Tonight is the first round, and God willing, we will hold the second round in July," stressed Regent Amirudin. Regent Amirudin admitted that the tournament was very important because it was a means of preparing young athletes from Banggai Regency to be able to represent Central Sulawesi at the national event. Because, this tournament does not only involve Banggai athletes, but also athletes from outside the region. "This is motivation for all of us to see outstanding athletes so that in the future our younger siblings can follow in their footsteps, which we will soon witness together," explained the Regent. Amirudin. Regent Amirudin also stated that he upheld sportsmanship, and made this tournament not only a competition event, but also a means of strengthening brotherhood among Banggai Regency badminton fans. On the same occasion, the Chair of the Regent Cup Badminton Open Tournament Committee, Ridwan T. Polopa, said that the number of participants from regencies/cities throughout Central Sulawesi was 583 participants. "The implementation period starts from February 1 to 4 2024," said Ridwan Polopa. Participants will compete for a prize of IDR 40 million. (*)

title: Lebih 500 Pebulutangkis Berlaga di Open Turnamen Bupati Banggai Cup
text: BANGGAI RAYA-Lebih 500 pebulutangkis dari kabupaten/kota se-Sulawesi Tengah berlaga di turnamen terbuka Bupati Banggai Cup 2024 di GOR Tompotika Kilongan, Kecamatan Luwuk Utara.Bupati Banggai Amirudin Tamoreka membuka kegiatan tersebut, Kamis (1/2/2024).Kegiatan yang dilaksanakan sampai dengan tanggal 4 Februari 2024 ini diikuti oleh 593 peserta yang berasal dari kabupaten/kota se-Sulawesi Tengah, dengan rincian Ganda Beregu Putra sebanyak 378 peserta, Ganda Putra Kelas A/B 72 peserta, Ganda Puteri 36 peserta, Tunggal U-15 52 peserta, Tunggal Putra 18 peserta dan Usia Dini sebanyak 27 peserta.BACA JUGA:Buah Tangan Ustadz Iswan, Kini Warga BTN Bukit Mambual Regency Miliki MasjidBACA JUGA:27 Tahun Toili, Bupati Banggai Potong TumpengDisamping hadiah yang telah disiapkan oleh pihak penyelenggara, kegiatan Badminton Open Tournament Bupati Cup Tahun 2024 ini memperebutkan Piala Bergilir Ganda Beregu Putra.Pada moment tersebut, Pengurus PBSI Kabupaten Banggai memberikan Piagam Penghargaan sekaligus menobatkan H. Amirudin sebagai Bapak Bulutangkis Kabupaten Banggai.BACA JUGA:Curi Receiver CCTV dan Wifi, Pria Asal Maahas Dibekuk PolisiTurut hadir menyaksikan pembukaan kegiatan Badminton Open Tournament 2024 unsur Forkopimda, sejumlah pimpinan OPD, beberapa Pimpnan BUMN/BUMD, undangan lainnya serta pemerhati olahraga badminton di Kabupaten Banggai.**
text_en: BANGGAI RAYA-More than 500 badminton players from districts/cities throughout Central Sulawesi competed in the 2024 Regent Banggai Cup open tournament at GOR Tompotika Kilongan, North Luwuk District. Banggai Regent Amirudin Tamoreka opened the activity, Thursday (1/2/2024). held until February 4 2024, 593 participants came from districts/cities throughout Central Sulawesi, with details of 378 Men's Team Doubles, 72 Class A/B Men's Doubles, 36 Women's Doubles, U-15 Singles 52 participants, 18 participants in Men's Singles and 27 Early Age participants. READ ALSO: A souvenir from Ustadz Iswan, now the residents of BTN Bukit Mambual Regency have a mosque. The 2024 Regent Cup Open Tournament will compete for the Men's Team Doubles Cup. At that moment, the PBSI Management of Banggai Regency gave an Award Certificate and crowned H. Amirudin as the Father of Badminton in Banggai Regency. READ ALSO: Stealing CCTV and Wifi Receiver, Man from Maahas Arrested by Police. were present to witness the opening of the 2024 Badminton Open Tournament activities, elements of Forkopimda, a number of OPD leaders, several BUMN/BUMD leaders, other invitees and observers of badminton sports in Banggai Regency.**

title: Demi Penuhi Kehidupan Sehari-hari, Pria di Banggai Nekat Curi Receiver CCTV dan Wifi
text: Laporan Wartawan TribunPalu.com, Asnawi Zikri TRIBUNPALU.COM, BANGGAI -Seorang pria nekat mencuri receiver kamera pengawas atau CCTV dan alat wifi indihome di Kelurahan Jole, Kecamatan Luwuk Selatan, KabupatenBanggai , Sulawesi Tengah. Pelaku teridentifikasi berinisial HB alias Dayat (40) warga Kelurahan Maahas, Luwuk Selatan itu langsung ditangkap Tim Resmob PolresBanggai , Kamis (1/2/2024). Diketahui, pelaku melakoni aksinya pada Selasa (30/1/2024) sekitar pukul 03.00 Wita. Sebelum beraksi, ia memasuki pekarangan gudang dengan melompati pagar, dan ia sendirian menggasak barang-barang tersebut. Kasat Reskrim PolresBanggai , AKP Tio Tondy menyebutkan, pihaknya mengamankan pelaku usai menerima laporan korban. “Setelah terima laporan, Tim Resmob amankan HB alias Dayat di rumahnya,” ujar AKP Tio. AKP Tio menyatakan bahwa total kerugian sekitar Rp 3 juta, dan saat diinterogasi pelaku mengaku akan menjual barang curian tersebut memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari. Akibat perbuatannya, pelaku dijerat Pasal 363 KUHPidana tentang tindak pidana pencurian. Ancaman hukumannya maksimal 7 tahun kurungan penjara. (*)
text_en: Report from TribunPalu.com Journalist, Asnawi Zikri TRIBUNPALU.COM, BANGGAI - A man was determined to steal a surveillance camera receiver or CCTV and an indihome wifi device in Jole Village, South Luwuk District, Banggai Regency, Central Sulawesi. The perpetrator identified with the initials HB alias Dayat (40), a resident of Maahas Village, South Luwuk, was immediately arrested by the Banggai Police Resmob Team, Thursday (1/2/2024). It is known that the perpetrator carried out the action on Tuesday (30/1/2024) at around 03.00 WITA. Before taking action, he entered the warehouse yard by jumping over the fence, and he alone stole the goods. Head of Criminal Investigation Unit for the Banggai Police, AKP Tio Tondy, said that his party arrested the perpetrator after receiving the victim's report. "After receiving the report, the Resmob Team secured HB alias Dayat at his house," said AKP Tio. AKP Tio stated that the total loss was around IDR 3 million, and when interrogated the perpetrator admitted that he would sell the stolen goods to meet his daily needs. As a result of his actions, the perpetrator was charged under Article 363 of the Criminal Code regarding the crime of theft. The maximum penalty is 7 years in prison. (*)

title: Gudang Aluminium di Pertokoan Luwuk Banggai Terbakar, Beruntung Cepat Dipadamkan
text: Laporan Wartawan TribunPalu.com, Asnawi Zikri TRIBUNPALU.COM, BANGGAI -Gudang bahan aluminium di Jl Teuku Umar Kompleks Pertokoan Kelurahan Luwuk, KabupatenBanggai , Sulawesi Tengah mengalami kebakaran, Jumat (2/2/2024) sekitar pukul 10.30 Wita. Plt. Kapolsek Luwuk AKP Steven Lewaherillah mengungkapkan, dari keterangan seorang saksi kbu Andui melihat kemunculan titik api di bagian samping bangunan gudang milik Donal Dusia (40). "Titik api muncul dari tumpukan gabus ikan tepat di samping gudang," ungkapnya. AKP Steven menyebutkan bahwa saat itu saksi lain mendengar teriakan dan keluar melihat api sudah membesar di bagian samping gudang. Sehingga langsung menghubungi pemadam kebakaran. Beruntung, api cepat dipadamkan sehingga tidak meluas. "Hanya bagian samping saja yang terbakar," kata AKP Steven. Ia menambahkan, kerugian material dalam peristiwa tersebut belum dapat dipastikan dan tidak ada korban jiwa. "Dugaan penyebab kebakaran belum dipastikan. Anggota masih mengumpulkan keterangan saksi," kata dia. (*)
text_en: Report from TribunPalu.com Journalist, Asnawi Zikri TRIBUNPALU.COM, BANGGAI - An aluminum warehouse on Jl Teuku Umar, Luwuk Village Shopping Complex, Banggai Regency, Central Sulawesi experienced a fire, Friday (2/2/2024) at around 10.30 WITA. Plt. Luwuk Police Chief AKP Steven Lewaherillah revealed that from the testimony of a witness, Andui's family saw the appearance of fire spots on the side of the warehouse building belonging to Donal Dusia (40). "The fire emerged from a pile of fish corks right next to the warehouse," he said. AKP Steven said that at that time another witness heard screams and came out to see the fire had spread to the side of the warehouse. So immediately contact the fire department. Luckily, the fire was quickly extinguished so it did not spread. "Only the side was burned," said AKP Steven. He added that material losses in this incident could not be ascertained and there were no casualties. "The suspected cause of the fire has not been confirmed. Members are still collecting witness statements," he said. (*)
